To embed hidden messages or data into digital images
To prove that a document hasn't been tampered with

To remove the watermark from the image completely

options.text: The image contains less information than can be represented by 8 bits per pixel
The image contains more information than can be represented by 8 bits per pixel
The image contains exactly 6.5 bits of information per pixel
The image contains exactly 8 bits of information per pixel

questions.text: In the context of Real Time Systems, what is the meaning of Starvation?

options.text: The process of halting execution of low-priority threads to prioritize high-priority ones
A situation where a thread is unable to acquire a required resource indefinitely
A condition where a thread consumes excessive CPU resources, leading to system slowdown
The occurrence of race conditions due to improper synchronization of concurrent threads

questions.text: Is a real-time system characterized primarily by its speed of execution?

options.text: Yes, a real time system must execute tasks quickly to meet timing requirements
Yes, a real time system always runs faster than non-real-time systems
No, a real time system is defined by its ability to perform tasks predictably within specified timing constraints
No, a real time system is characterized by its focus on user interaction

questions.text: What does "Deadlock" refers to?

options.text: Multiple threads accessing a shared resource at the same time
A situation in which a thread consumes all the CPU, slowing down the system
When a task with bigger priority is blocked by another task with lower priority
Two or more threads are indefinitely blocked, waiting for each other to release resources

questions.text: What is the main difference between a real time system and a non real time system?

options.text: Real time systems always execute tasks faster than non real time system
One must meet timing constraints and deadlines while for the other this is not necessary
Real time systems rely exclusively on cloud-based computing resources

questions.text: Why can it be said that the EDF scheduling is optimal?

It minimizes the number of context switches
It guarantees fair allocation of resources among the tasks
it minimizes the deadline miss ratio by prioritizing tasks with closer deadlines
